intro: Wilckia maritima var. floribunda, commonly known as the golden glory, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmate leaves with a rough texture and is often found growing in sandy or saline soils. It is adapted to coastal environments, tolerating high salinity and strong winds. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in warm climates.
